\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+broadcast(apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t $\ast$cond)}{apr_thread_cond_broadcast(apr_thread_cond_t *cond)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+broadcast (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{cond}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__thread__cond_gafbbedd2a07629fe3186343035ae83152}{}\label{group__apr__thread__cond_gafbbedd2a07629fe3186343035ae83152}
Signals all threads blocking on the given condition variable. Each thread that was signaled is then scheduled to wake up and acquire the associated mutex. This will happen in a serialized manner. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em cond} & the condition variable on which to produce the broadcast. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
If no threads are waiting on the condition variable, nothing happens. 
\end{DoxyRemark}

Note\+: destroying a condition variable (or likewise, destroying or clearing the pool from which a condition variable was allocated) if any threads are blocked waiting on it gives undefined results. Create and initialize a condition variable that can be used to signal and schedule threads in a single process.

\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+signal(apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t $\ast$cond)}{apr_thread_cond_signal(apr_thread_cond_t *cond)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+signal (

\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__thread__cond_gadf7ad6c2731bc6128f969d3efc7ff5eb}{}\label{group__apr__thread__cond_gadf7ad6c2731bc6128f969d3efc7ff5eb}
Signals a single thread, if one exists, that is blocking on the given condition variable. That thread is then scheduled to wake up and acquire the associated mutex. Although it is not required, if predictable scheduling is desired, that mutex must be locked while calling this function. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em cond} & the condition variable on which to produce the signal. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
If no threads are waiting on the condition variable, nothing happens. 
\end{DoxyRemark}
\index{Condition Variable Routines@{Condition Variable Routines}!apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+timedwait@{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+timedwait}}
\index{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+timedwait@{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+timedwait}!Condition Variable Routines@{Condition Variable Routines}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+timedwait(apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t $\ast$cond, apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+mutex\+\_\+t $\ast$mutex, apr\+\_\+interval\+\_\+time\+\_\+t timeout)}{apr_thread_cond_timedwait(apr_thread_cond_t *cond, apr_thread_mutex_t *mutex, apr_interval_time_t timeout)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+timedwait (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{cond, }
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+mutex\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{mutex, }
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+interval\+\_\+time\+\_\+t}}]{timeout}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__thread__cond_ga67f2feecb7fa1929cc9b354dafd00306}{}\label{group__apr__thread__cond_ga67f2feecb7fa1929cc9b354dafd00306}
Put the active calling thread to sleep until signaled to wake up or the timeout is reached. Each condition variable must be associated with a mutex, and that mutex must be locked before calling this function, or the behavior will be undefined. As the calling thread is put to sleep, the given mutex will be simultaneously released; and as this thread wakes up the lock is again simultaneously acquired. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em cond} & the condition variable on which to block. \\
\hline
{\em mutex} & the mutex that must be locked upon entering this function, is released while the thread is asleep, and is again acquired before returning from this function. \\
\hline
{\em timeout} & The amount of time in microseconds to wait. This is a maximum, not a minimum. If the condition is signaled, we will wake up before this time, otherwise the error A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+T\+I\+M\+E\+UP is returned. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\index{Condition Variable Routines@{Condition Variable Routines}!apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+wait@{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+wait}}
\index{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+wait@{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+wait}!Condition Variable Routines@{Condition Variable Routines}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+wait(apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t $\ast$cond, apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+mutex\+\_\+t $\ast$mutex)}{apr_thread_cond_wait(apr_thread_cond_t *cond, apr_thread_mutex_t *mutex)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+wait (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+cond\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{cond, }
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+thread\+\_\+mutex\+\_\+t} $\ast$}]{mutex}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__thread__cond_ga789719a5f02bdab8b8abbc8bddd0406b}{}\label{group__apr__thread__cond_ga789719a5f02bdab8b8abbc8bddd0406b}
Put the active calling thread to sleep until signaled to wake up. Each condition variable must be associated with a mutex, and that mutex must be locked before calling this function, or the behavior will be undefined. As the calling thread is put to sleep, the given mutex will be simultaneously released; and as this thread wakes up the lock is again simultaneously acquired. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em cond} & the condition variable on which to block. \\
\hline
{\em mutex} & the mutex that must be locked upon entering this function, is released while the thread is asleep, and is again acquired before returning from this function. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
Spurious wakeups may occur. Before and after every call to wait on a condition variable, the caller should test whether the condition is already met. 
\end{DoxyRemark}
